ayah: For the accustomed security of the Quraysh[1996] -
footnotes: [1996] i.e., the honor and reputation Allāh had given them as guardians of the Holy Kaʿbah, which allowed them to travel without fear of being harmed.

ayah: Their accustomed security [in] the caravan of winter and summer[1997] -
footnotes: [1997] i.e., the trading caravans that traveled south in winter and north in summer.

ayah: Let them worship the Lord of this House,[1998]
Who has fed them, [saving them] from hunger and made them safe, [saving them] from fear.
